For the app to run smoothly in the background, please set the Battery saver to \'No restrictions\', in the Background Settings, through \'App info\' in Settings. The app is designed for minimum battery use.

The app needs Phone permission to make calls, including emergency calls via the Distress button.

To let the app show pop-up windows during calls, the \'Draw over other apps\' permission must be enabled in your device settings. On Xiaomi phones, you\'ll need to turn this permission on manually. Tap below to open settings and enable it.
Default Phone App (Dialer) permission was not granted but needed for the app to answer calls.
Phone (Call) permission denied, but needed to make calls (especially in emergency).
Read Contacts permission was denied but needed in order view Contacts.
Calls Log permission was denied but needed in order view calls.
To filter blocked contacts, please set the app as the default app.
It is important to set the app as your default phone app to allow it to handle calls for you (especially in emergency).

The app was designed specifically to simplify answering incoming calls – by using a large button instead of swiping on the device, an action that can sometimes be challenging for older people.

Family members can change the settings as needed, making the app both simple and powerful with many features.

Manage your calls easily and use the app as your primary dialer for receiving and managing calls.

The app includes a wide range of useful features, specifically tailored for seniors, to manage all types of calls, both incoming and outgoing.\n\nThe app is designed to be very simple and easy to use, but you can always change the settings easily by tapping on the menu at the top of the screen (tap on the three dots).

It is recommended to seek help from close friends or family members to adjust the app settings so that they best suit your needs.

In the Settings screen, you can choose who can call you, such as only contacts, only favorites, or only non-blocked numbers.

You can also restrict outgoing calls if necessary. It is important to remember that the emergency button and the golden number will still work even if outgoing calls are restricted or blocked, as they depend solely on the phone's outgoing call permission.

Additionally, you can choose to start calls with the speakerphone on, set the app to answer calls automatically, and access other options that help the app function in the most customized and optimal way for you.

It is possible to enable the app to automatically answer incoming calls, without the need to press the answer button when a new call is received.

The app allows the device to ring two or three times, so that you are alerted to the incoming call.

Auto answering can be enabled only for certain contacts, by tapping on them in the Contacts screen and then checking the checkbox.

Using this option may cause confusion for those who are not accustomed to auto answering, and its use is solely the responsibility of the user.

You can set up a gold number for quick and easy calls to a close contact using the settings screen, and then call them via the Contacts tab or the dialer.

Calls to the gold number are possible even when outgoing calls are restricted in the app, as they only require call permission.

Note: An emergency number can be designated as the gold number, but please note that the app is not intended for emergency situations; it is designed to make your calls simple and enjoyable.

For the app to be able to manage calls and answer them even when it is not running, it must be set as the default call management app.

Additionally, for the app to function properly, it requires additional permissions:
\1. Phone (for making calls).
\2. Opening new windows in the background (display above other apps).
3. Access to contacts.
4. Viewing the call log.
5. Permission to display on the lock screen.

The app will only use the permissions it has received solely for proper call management.

Most of the device permissions required for the app are automatically granted during installation or when setting the app as the default for calls.

Permissions can always be requested through the app's permissions screen, using the menu at the top of the screen (the 'three dots' menu).

It is recommended to seek help from family members and close contacts, if needed.

Due to the unique permission settings on Xiaomi devices, it is not possible to automatically detect the permission to display over other apps, which is required for background operation during incoming calls.

You can enable this permission manually via the app's permissions screen.

Note: The images are for illustration purposes only, and the configuration and appearance of the permissions may vary between devices.

To ensure that the app functions properly and manages calls, it must be set as the default call management app.\n\nWithout this permission, the app will not be able to answer calls when it is not open and in focus.

To ensure the app runs smoothly in the background and can answer calls, please make sure that no restrictions are applied to its operation in the device settings.

Please set the battery saving mode for the app to "Unrestricted". This can be done via the "App Details" in the settings menu under the background settings.

Note: Battery saving settings may vary between devices. The key is to ensure that the device does not restrict the app's operation.

The app is designed for minimal battery consumption.

To keep the app running smoothly in the background, it is important to set the Battery saver to have no restrictions. The app is designed for minimum battery use. Are you sure you want to skip this step?
In order for the app to handle calls from the background (while it\'s not loaded), it is important to grant Overlay Draw permission. Are you sure you want to skip this step?
Enable app to show Call screen from background
Please enter \'Other Permissions\' and there grant access to \'Display pop-up windows while running in the background\'
The app needs a few permissions in order to manage your calls in a clear and friendly way.
The app must become the default Calls handler (Default App/Dialer) in order to receive and make phone calls. Granting this permission usually trigger Contacts, Phone and Calls view permissions.
The Overlay Draw permission is required for Call Display, from the background, when the app itself is not loaded, for incoming and active calls.
The app needs Phone (Call) permission in order to make phone calls as the Default Phone App for handling calls.
The application needs Contacts permission in order to let you call existing Contacts and to show the Contacts of phone numbers.
The application needs to have the Phone Log permission in order to show recent Incoming and Outgoing calls.

📞 ** How to Enable Phone Permission Manually **
It seems the app’s permission %1$s has been denied. To enable this feature again, follow these simple steps:
1️⃣ ** Open Settings ** Tap the **Settings** app on your phone (⚙️).
2️⃣ ** Find Permissions or Apps ** Scroll down and look for **Apps** or **App Permissions** (name may vary).
3️⃣ ** Go to Permission Manager ** Inside the app settings, look for the option called **Permissions** or **Permission Manager**.
4️⃣ ** Select \"%2$s\" Permission ** Tap on **Phone**, then find this app in the list.
5️⃣ ** Enable Permission ** Tap the app’s name and select **Allow** to grant the permission.
🔄 ** Restart the App ** After enabling the permission, the app should adjust automatically. In case you experience some issue, please close the app and open it again to ensure everything works smoothly.
If you need help, please ask someone to guide you, or contact support.

Please enable the "Show on lock screen" permission.

To enable this permission, please follow these steps:
1. Open your device settings.
2. Navigate to the "Other Permissions" category.
3. Locate the "Show on lock screen" option and enable it.

Please note: On different devices, the permission may appear under a different name or in a different location. If you cannot find it, try looking in other settings categories.

The app requires permission to run in the background, in order to answer calls when it is not in focus. You can grant this permission either through the app\’s Permissions screen or by adjusting the app’s settings in your device’s settings menu.
No contacts are displayed because outgoing calls are disabled. You can change this option in the app\'s Settings menu.

Welcome to the %1$s application.

The application has been developed as an aid tool for adult users, and its purpose is to facilitate easier call management on Android devices and enable quick contact with predefined contacts in distress situations.

The application and the services provided through it shall hereinafter be referred to as "the System".

1. Agreement to the Terms:
Use of the System is subject to the following Terms ("the Terms"). Please read these Terms carefully before using the System. Your use of the System constitutes your full and irrevocable acceptance of these Terms.

If you do not agree to these Terms, in whole or in part, please do not use the System and remove it from your device immediately.

2. Summary of the System's Purpose:
Facilitating easier call management by emphasizing large buttons and text optimized for elderly users.

3. Important Clarification Regarding the Distress Button and Automated Call Answering:
* It is recommended to initially test the distress button functionality with a predefined contact and in coordination with them to ensure proper operation. The System includes a distress button designed for quick dialing to a predefined phone number, and may also feature automated call answering and a "golden number" function. It is important to emphasize that the application is not a professional emergency application and does not replace direct contact with official emergency centers (such as police, ambulance, fire brigade, etc.). Reliance solely on the distress button or automated call answering in critical situations is not advised, as malfunctions may occur (e.g., signal issues, network failures, permission blocks, operating system limitations, or battery-saving restrictions). It is recommended to have additional backup means for emergency communication.

4. Privacy, Personal Data Protection, and Call Recording:
The System enables users to view various data stored on the smartphone, such as contacts and call logs as saved in the device. This information is not stored within the application nor shared with any third party. Please note that the application does not record any telephone calls made through it, and the System does not store or log calls in any manner.

5. Usage Restrictions:
It is strictly prohibited to use the System for any purpose other than personal or private use, or for any commercial purposes, including the dissemination of false alerts using the distress button.

6. Liability and Limitation of Liability:
The application and the services provided therein are offered "as-is" ("AS-IS"). The developers are not responsible for adapting the System to the user's needs, for any errors, inaccuracies, or changes in the information displayed, or for any changes made by the user or third parties. The developers shall not be liable for any direct or indirect damages resulting from use of the System, including damages arising from call answering, automated call answering, the golden number, the distress button, or any other component of the application. Users assume all risk regarding use of the System, and the developers accept no liability for malfunctions, operational failures, or damages resulting from improper use or over-reliance on the System.

7. Changes, Updates, and Termination of Service:
The operators of the application reserve the right to modify, update, or discontinue the System at any time without prior notice.

8. Contact for Inquiries or Complaints:
For inquiries, complaints, or questions, please contact support@easycallandanswer.com.

9. User Declaration and Consent:
Please note: This window is displayed solely for reading and reviewing the Terms and does not constitute acceptance. Acceptance of the Terms is done on the previous screen by selecting "I agree to the Terms of Use".
By selecting "I agree to the Terms of Use", you declare that you have read, understood, and fully agree to these Terms.

10. Intellectual Property Rights:
All content, features, and functionality within the System, including but not limited to software, text, graphics, logos, and design, are the exclusive property of the developers and are protected by intellectual property laws.

All Rights Reserved © Easy Call and Answer 2025.

* It is recommended to initially test the distress button functionality with a predefined contact to ensure proper operation.

The distress button in the app is designed to help you quickly reach out for assistance in an emergency situation, and it remains active even if outgoing calls are completely disabled in the app settings. However, you must ensure that both the device and the app are capable of making outgoing calls.

Please note that the app is not intended to serve as a professional emergency application, does not substitute official emergency services and is not directly connected to emergency centers such as police, ambulance, or fire brigade.

However, you can configure the distress button to dial a specific emergency number, if the necessary permission is granted to retrieve emergency numbers.

Emergency numbers are retrieved from the Android system, and therefore depend on your region and device. This means that the numbers may not always be appropriate for the country you are in. When choosing an emergency number, it is your responsibility to verify that it is the correct one for you.

Additionally, you can select a contact (if Contacts permission is granted) whom the app will attempt to call in an emergency situation.

Important: The button requires Phone (outgoing call) permission on the device itself to function! It is also recommended to set the app as the default phone dialer; otherwise, the app may attempt to place the call externally.

If the distress button displays a bell icon, it is ready for use. Otherwise, please make sure your device supports outgoing calls and that Phone permission is granted.

If permissions are missing, you can grant them via the Permissions screen in the app or in the device settings.
Warning: A number for the distress button has been selected, but the "Phone" permission (Outgoing calls) is missing. Therefore, the distress button cannot work.

Send a call report to a close contact.

Monitor call activity to help ensure everything is okay. You'll receive a clear summary of incoming and outgoing calls.

The report includes patterns like:

• Frequent calls to the same number
• Unknown or unsaved callers
• Outgoing calls made at unusual hours

It's a simple way to stay connected and aware, especially when caring for an aging parent.

You can always change the call report settings via the three-dots menu at the top of the screen.

Please note: You are solely responsible for how this information is used and shared. Make sure to respect privacy and comply with local laws regarding data use.
Call Report screen is already opened
Send alert via SMS to Gold Number
If call was not answered, play increasing Siren sound, after 15 seconds
Show WhatsApp messages on lock screen
Show SMS messages on lock screen
Select Contact to receive the report
A call is considered exceptional if it is NOT between
A number is considered exceptional if it appears more than
Number is considered exceptional if it\'s not in Contacts
Welcome to Easy Call And Answer!

Please let me know if you want to call someone. Just speak his name after I will finish talking. You can say \'Call Emergency\' in order to active the Distress button. Also, you can say \'Gold Number\' for calling gold number. You can open the Premium Tour from the top menu to view all voice commands

The premium version of the app unlocks powerful features designed to significantly enhance your user experience — especially for Android users who need accessibility, ease of use, and remote control.\\n\\nFull voice control lets you answer calls, activate the emergency button, and perform actions — all without touching the device. Just make sure there\\\'s no background noise interfering with voice recognition.\\n\\nYou\\’ll also benefit from a smart lock screen that allows you to quickly return to the app with a single tap.\\n\\nA newly added feature is the call report — a useful tool that helps identify whether unwanted calls were received or accidental calls were made. The report is sent only to a number you choose, and the app does not store or use the data otherwise.\\n\\nResponsibility for using these features — and the app in general — rests entirely with you, the user.
Swipe left to continue\nto the next step

Our special smart and custom lock screen offers a new, effortless experience. Instead of struggling with awkward swipe gestures or finding how to unlock the device – a single tap takes you right back to the app. Easy, fast, and always available when you need it.
You can also open it using a voice command. No need to touch the device – just say the magic word and the screen responds. Perfect for when your hands are busy or when quick access is essential.
The screen shows smart notifications from SMS and WhatsApp messages. Content is shown in read-only mode – so even if it's tapped by mistake, no chat will open. This is especially helpful for elderly users who may press something by accident.
This isn't just a lock screen – it's a thoughtful gateway that makes everyday use smoother, boosts control, and gives you peace of mind. With clean design, intuitive control, and voice support, it’s a real upgrade to your mobile experience.

Imagine full control of your app — without lifting a finger. Just speak, and the system takes care of the rest. Answer calls, trigger emergency help, contact a loved one, or unlock your screen — all with your voice alone. When your hands are full or touch isn\'t practical, voice control keeps things effortless, fast, and natural. Even on the move or from across the room, the system responds — as long as it\'s quiet enough. It\’s not just convenience — it’s accessibility, safety, and powerful tech that puts you in charge.

Stay informed about your loved one’s call activity. The report shows the incoming and outgoing calls — so you know they’re not calling by mistake or receiving calls from unknown or suspicious numbers.

When every second counts, advanced protection makes all the difference. The premium distress button doesn\'t just place a call — it also sends an emergency SMS with your location and time, and if there\'s no answer or the call doesn\'t go through, a loud alarm will sound to alert those nearby.

You can make your experience even smoother by setting up voice commands that work best for you.\\n\\n\nIt is advisable to choose commands that are easy to say, clear, and unique — this helps the app understand you better
